title: Lakatriona Brunson
text:
Lakatriona Brunson (born May 15, 1977) is an American teacher, athlete, coach and actress. She is best known for her character Bernice on the <a href="truTV">truTV</a> television series "<a href="South%20Beach%20Tow">South Beach Tow</a>".
Early life and education.
Lakatriona Brunson was born and raised in <a href="Miami">Miami</a>, <a href="Florida">Florida</a>. She attended <a href="Miami%20Northwestern%20Senior%20High%20School">Miami Northwestern Senior High School</a> in the 1990s, where she excelled in <a href="track%20and%20field">track and field</a> and <a href="basketball">basketball</a>. She continued competing in college, both in track and field and as a <a href="power%20forward%20%28basketball%29">power forward</a> on the basketball team at <a href="Tennessee%20State%20University">Tennessee State University</a>.
Career.
Brunson is widely known for her performances as Bernice, a <a href="tow%20truck">tow truck</a> operator on the <a href="docudrama">docudrama</a> TV series "<a href="South%20Beach%20Tow">South Beach Tow</a>". The show, shown in <a href="reality%20TV">reality TV</a> format (although some portions are reenactments), based itself on the operations of a towing operation in southern Florida, Tremont Towing. Bernice's character traits include disposing of unruly members of the public and <a href="Illeism">referring to herself in the third-person</a>. She is known for wearing sunglasses in her TV role and otherwise. Although Tremont Towing is an actual towing company used by the city of <a href="Miami%20Beach%2C%20Florida">Miami Beach</a> for towing illegally parked cars, the show's cast were fictionalized employees.
Brunson continued competing athletically as a <a href="defensive%20end">defensive end</a> for the <a href="Miami%20Fury">Miami Fury</a> <a href="American%20football">football</a> team of the <a href="Independent%20Women%27s%20Football%20League">Independent Women's Football League</a>.
Brunson is also a certified <a href="physical%20education">physical education</a> teacher. When she was named head coach of the <a href="Miami%20Jackson%20High%20School">Miami Jackson High School</a> football team in February 2016, she became the first female football coach in Florida. Brunson coached girls' <a href="flag%20football">flag football</a> at Jackson and was an assistant coach for the girls' basketball team. <a href="Luther%20Campbell">Luther Campbell</a>, known internationally as rapper <a href="Luke%20Skyywalker">Luke Skyywalker</a> of the 1980s group <a href="2%20Live%20Crew">2 Live Crew</a>, was hired as an assistant coach and was a defensive coordinator. However, he resigned his position after nine months. Brunson has known Campbell since her childhood.
Personal life.
Brunson has remained a resident of Miami.
